attributes.action: GIVE US AN IMMEDIATE NATIONAL, LEGALLY BINDING, REFERENDUM on whether or not Her Majesty The Queen should use whatever emergency powers she might still have to intervene and to order a dissolution of parliament on grounds of unsavoury and in many cases illegal activity by the people who currently occupy the House of Commons.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Gordon Brown won't bow to public and peer pressure to get rid of Gorbals Mick so he is not likely to do anything which endangers his own continued access to huge amounts of taxpayer pounds.  However, the people are not happy and they must be given an opportunity - through a national legally binding referendum (conducted within the next 7 days) to ask them if they want HM The Queen to intervene and remove everybody from the chamber and get them to re-apply for their jobs.

rejection.details: As explained in our terms and conditions, excessive use of capital letters can make petitions fall foul of our "wording that is impossible to understand" criteria: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/terms
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
Language which is offensive, intemperate, or provocative
Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
